text: A fibre-reinforced polymer (also fibre-reinforced plastic (FRP)) is a composite material that consists of a polymer matrix that is reinforced with fibres. The fibres are usually fibreglass, carbon, or aramid, the polymer is usually an epoxy, vinylester or polyester thermosetting plastic. FRPs are commonly used in the aerospace, automobile, marine, and construction industries. ==Related pages== * Glass-reinforced plastic ==Other websites== * Business Week story about FRPs used to construct bridges Category:Polymers Category:Synthetic materials
title: Fibre-reinforced polymer
